GfxFeatureMapImageRequest Class Reference

A request that asks for and receives a gfx feature map. More...

Detailed Description

A request that asks for and receives a gfx feature map.

Definition at line 43 of file GfxFeatureMapImageRequest.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

GfxFeatureMapImageRequest::GfxFeatureMapImageRequest (  const RequestData &  idOrParent,
const MC2BoundingBox *  bboxLatLon,
uint16  screenX,
uint16  screenY,
LangTypes::language_t  language,
const RouteReplyPacket *  p,
bool  image,
bool  exportFormat,
bool  drawCopyRight,
ImageDrawConfig::imageFormat  format,
uint16  sizeParam,
MapSettings *  mapSettings,
const TopRegionRequest *  topReq,
const MC2BoundingBox &  ccBBox,
uint32  maxScale = INVALID_SCALE_LEVEL,
uint32  minScale = CONTINENT_LEVEL,
uint32  filtScale = INVALID_SCALE_LEVEL,
bool  extractForTileMaps = false,
uint32  zoom = MAX_UINT32
) 
 

Create a GfxFeatureMapImageRequest.

Parameters:
idOrParent Unique request ID or parent request.
bboxLatLon The requested bbox.
screenX Width of requesters area, 0 is inf.
screenY Height of requesters area, 0 is inf.
language The prefered language of names.
p The RouteReplyPacket.
image Is set to true if you want an image in return. If it's set to false you get a GfxFeatureMap in return.
exportFormat Is set to true if you want a GfxExportFeatureMap in return. If you want a GfxFeatureMap or an image in return it is set to false.
drawCopyRight If we want a copyright in the image.
format The Image format.
sizeParam The size parameter from the server.
mapSettings The MapSettings to use.
topReq Pointer to valid TopRegionRequest with data
maxScale The maximum (most detailed) scalelevel that is requested. If INVALID_SCALE_LEVEL, the screensize will be used to determine this.
minScale The minimum (least detailed) scalelevel that is requested. If not specified, CONTINENT_LEVEL (the least detailed scalelevel) will be used.
filtScale The scalelevel used when filtering features. If INVALID_SCALE_LEVEL, the maximum (most detailed) scalelevel will be used.
extractForTileMaps If the gfxfeaturemap should be used for creating tilemaps or not.
zoom Level of zoom for some projections.

virtual GfxFeatureMapImageRequest::~GfxFeatureMapImageRequest (   )  [virtual]
 

Destructor.

lon The longitude of the symbol.
name The name of the symbol.
symbol The type of symbol.
symbolImage The image of the feature used if USER_DEFINED symbol, is copied. Default "".

void GfxFeatureMapImageRequest::concatenateMapAnswers (   )  [private]

set<uint32>* GfxFeatureMapImageRequest::getAllowedGfxMapIDs (   )  const [private]
 

Create the speical allowed maps for Tre in Italy hack.

virtual PacketContainer* GfxFeatureMapImageRequest::getAnswer (   )  [virtual]
 

In case an image or the gfxfeature export format is requested then the answer will be in the form of a replypacket.

In case a gfxfeaturemap is requested, then the answer should be retrieved by getGFMDataHolder() instead. In that case this method will return NULL.

Note that the caller of this method must delete the answer afterwards.

Reimplemented from Request.

The MC2BoundingBox for city centres.

void GfxFeatureMapImageRequest::setMapRotation (  int16  rotationAngle  ) 
 

Set the rotation for the map.

Parameters:
rotationAngle Rotation in degrees. Valid range [0 - 360], 0 => north up, clocwise rotation is positive.

void GfxFeatureMapImageRequest::setRouteTurn (  uint32  beforeTurn,
uint32  afterTurn,
RouteArrowType::arrowType  arrow = RouteArrowType::TURN_ARROW
) 
 

Sets the route turn to draw on the image.

This requires a route.

Parameters:
beforeTurn The index of the feature before the turn.
NB. This is the index counting from the first rotue feature, i.e. if the empty features should be used to convert this id to the feature id in the GfxFeatureMap, 1 must be added in order to compensate for the route origin.

Parameters:
afterTurn The index of the feature after the turn.
NB. This is the index counting from the first rotue feature, i.e. if the empty features should be used to convert this id to the feature id in the GfxFeatureMap, 1 must be added in order to compensate for the route origin.

Parameters:
arrow The arrow type used to indicate the turn.

void GfxFeatureMapImageRequest::setUser (  const UserItem *  user  )  [inline]
 

Set the user for the request.
